channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Floods Force Rescues in Iowa and South Dakota
item.description: Parts of the Upper Midwest remained under flood warnings on Sunday morning, after days of heavy rain pushed some rivers to record levels.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israeli Airstrikes Hit Gaza City; Casualties Are Reported
item.description: The Israeli military said fighter jets had targeted “Hamas military infrastructure” at two sites. Gazan authorities reported multiple dead and said people were trapped under rubble.

item.title: Gen Z’s most notable status symbols, and the motivations behind them
item.description: Erewhon smoothies, thrifted Coach bags and platinum American Express cards are Gen Z's status symbols—and they signify a lot more than bank balance.

item.title: Heat Wave Enters 7th Day, but the End Is in Sight
item.description: The unusually early heat wave that has gripped much of the country may let up early this week, forecasters predict.

item.title: A Times Reporter on His Father’s Years in Mao’s Army in China
item.description: For nearly a decade, I worked in China as a Times correspondent and bureau chief. But it wasn’t until researching for a book that I uncovered the full story of my father’s role in Communist rule.

item.title: This is the ‘special sauce’ behind American exceptionalism—and why the U.S. stock market could continue dominating
item.description: “Many countries have these various advantages, but none have the combination—or the entire package—quite like the U.S. does,” RiverFront Investment Group’s chief strategist said.

item.title: Fact-Checking Biden’s and Trump’s Claims About the Economy
item.description: We fact-checked claims about inflation, jobs and tax policy from both presidential candidates.

item.title: Many Israelis Blame Hamas for Gaza Suffering, and Feel Little Sympathy
item.description: Despite being aware of the devastation in the enclave, many in Israel ask why they should show pity when Palestinians there showed none on Oct. 7.

item.title: Pets make for the best financial advisers and motivators. They force you to be more mindful about your spending, study shows
item.description: Pets inspire good money habits such as long-term investments and emergency savings.

item.title: Clippers Cut a Wide Swath Making Political Campaign Videos Go Viral
item.description: Despite criticism that the most-watched moments omit crucial context, candidates are tapping into the practice — and watching their words.

item.title: The Nation Resurgent, and Borders, Too
item.description: In France, as in the United States, feelings harden against immigrants, and President Emmanuel Macron and President Biden take note.

item.title: Deel CEO was told he’d need to replace his entire leadership team for the business to reach unicorn status—now it’s valued at $12 billion and he’s ‘kept 80% of the same team as when it was at $0’
item.description: Entrepreneurs perhaps expect to lose sleep when scaling their venture from the ground up into a unicorn—but Deel's founder Alex Bouaziz was warned he’d have to also lose his entire leadership team in the process.

item.title: A Times Reporter on His Father’s Years in Mao’s Army in China
item.description: For nearly a decade, I worked in China as a Times correspondent and bureau chief. But it wasn’t until researching for a book that I uncovered the full story of my father’s role in Communist rule.

item.title: ‘Make Millions Before Grandma Dies’ Brings Tears to Southeast Asia
item.description: A tear-jerker from Thailand, “How to Make Millions Before Grandma Dies,” has become a surprise hit across the region. Its theme is universal: bonding with family.

item.title: The wealthy are dropping up to $10,000 a month on social wellness clubs to relax and reverse age with their peers
item.description: Members-only social wellness clubs offer curated experiences and luxury amenities.
